author: wired blogs
text: date: tue, 2 nov 1999 10:07:24 +1100 from: david.white@solution6.comto: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: real snooping by real networksi find it funny that this is news ("realnetworks probe begins," 1.nov.99). i mean it is, but it shouldn't be. why would a successful company interested in making lots of money develop and release some software for free? because they're nice? i don't think so. they must be making money from it. are there ads in the software? barely - not enough to justify the development cost, and make a good profit.if you took a small step back, you'd realize that real jukebox is just a consumer survey tool. they don't say that they don't use the information about your habits as a listener, and with a big market uptake, the market data they can accrue is very valuable.
